intro: Reseda stricta var. funkii, commonly known as the narrowleaf reseda, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. This variant is noted for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in arid environments.
